body.title: Fard of Ghusl
body.question: Is the statement below true or false?

correct.answer:
To fulfill the fard of ghusl, you need to:
- wash your entire body,
- rinse your mouth,
- rinse your nose.
correct.reason: These actions are indeed the necessary minimum of ghusl

say Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Raheem

wash private parts

rinse mouth and nose properly

body.title: Preventing water
body.question: What substances must be removed before performing wudu?
body.hint: There are multiple correct answers.

correct.answer: Nail polish
correct.reason: Nail polish should be removed before performing wudu to ensure water reaches the nails.

correct.answer: Substances blocking water
correct.reason: All substances that block water from reaching the parts being washed should be removed before performing wudu.

wrong.reason: It is enough to move them such that the water riches skin under them.

body.title: Non-Obligatory Actions in Wudu (Ablution)
body.question: What are some of the non-obligatory but recommended actions in Wudu (Ablution)?

correct.answer: Using a toothstick (miswak)
correct.reason: Using a toothstick (miswak) is not an obligatory action in ablution. In the absence of a toothstick, the thumb and index finger of the right hand can be used.

correct.answer: Rinsing the entire mouth and the soft part of the nose three times
correct.reason: Rinsing the entire mouth and the soft part of the nose three times is not an obligatory action in ablution.

wrong.reason: Washing the hair is not a recommended action in ablution.

body.title: Actions in Wudu
body.question: Which of these are among the sunnahs of wudu?

correct.answer: Rinsing the mouth and nose
Using miswak
correct.reason: Miswak is a toothstick, it is sunnah to brush the teeth during wudu. In the absence of a toothstick, the thumb and index finger of the right hand can be used.

correct.answer: Saying Basmala
correct.reason: BismiLlaahir-Rahmaanir-Raheem.

wrong.reason: It is not a part of wudu.

body.title: Wudu according to sunnah
body.question: Put the actions of wudu in the correct order.
body.hint: The intention comes first
body.components:
Make an intention to perform wudu
Say Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Raheem
Wash your hands up to the wrists
Use miswak to brush your teeth
Rinse your mouth and nose three times
Wash your face three times
Run wet fingers through the beard
Wash the hands and arm up to and including the elbows
Wipe the entire head once, and ears with the same water
Wash both feet up to and including the ankles, while using fingers to wash between the toes

body.title: Intention in Wudu

correct.answer: It is sunnah to make an intention to perform wudu
correct.reason: Making an intention is indeed sunnah of wudu in Hanafi. However, other schools consider it fard, so better not to miss it.

body.title: Number of times according to sunnah

body.title: For whom?
body.question: What are the conditions that make prayer obligatory for a person?
body.hint: There are three of them

correct.answer: Being a Muslim
correct.reason: Being Muslim is the first condition.

correct.answer: Being sane
correct.reason: Being sane is a condition, and insanity excuses one from the obligation.

correct.answer: Reaching puberty
correct.reason: Reaching puberty is a condition, and praying is not obligatory for children.

wrong.reason: This is not a condition. Every Muslim has to pray, not only the "good" ones.
This is not a condition. Instead, it is the prayer that helps one to stop committing sins.

body.title: Pillars of Islam
body.question: What are the five pillars of Islam?
body.hint: The pillars are practices, i.e. actions.

correct.answer: testifying that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah
correct.reason: This is the first pillar.

correct.answer: performing the prayer
correct.reason: Prayer (a.k.a. namaz or salah) is the second pillar of Islam obligatory for every Muslim person who reached puberty.

correct.answer: giving zakat
correct.reason: Zakat is the charity obligatory for wealthy Muslims, and is the third pillar of Islam

correct.answer: fasting in Ramadan
correct.reason: This is the forth pillar of Islam. In the holy month of Ramadan, Muslims fast during daytime.

correct.answer: performing pilgrimage to the House
correct.reason: Hajj to Makkah is the fifth pillar, and is obligatory for those who have the means to perform it.

wrong.reason: Believing in angels is part of Imaan (true faith). Seeing them is not a must.
Believing in Revealed Books is part of Imaan (true faith). Reading and memorizing the Quran is praiseworthy.
